text.text_translated: Religion, which is a system of faith and worship, is very important to Pi. Although his family follows Hinduism, Pi shows interest in other faiths, which leads him to make friends with a Christian priest and a Muslim baker. To everyone's surprise, Pi declares himself to be Hindu, Muslim, and Christian at the same time. When his family and teachers ask him to choose only one religion, Pi refuses, saying, 'I just want to love God'. From that moment, his family and teachers decide to let him make his own mind up about religion.
